definition: to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
variant of 闊|阔[kuo4]
rich/wide/broad

sentences.english: He did not believe in flaunting his wealth.
sentences.chinese: 他不相信摆阔有什么好处。

sentences.english: This girl likes to put on the dog.
He objected on principle to luxury and ostentation .
This year, those ostentatious displays will take a back seat to social responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 今年，这些摆阔和炫耀将让位于社会责任的话题。

sentences.english: After he failed in business, his family had great difficulty keeping up an appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他经商失败以后，他一家人想摆阔便感力不从心了。

sentences.english: Although the family of Hitchcock was very rich, they did not show it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管希区柯克家很有钱，但家人并不摆阔。

sentences.english: The bounder's ostentatious life showed his inanition .
sentences.chinese: 暴发户摆阔的生活方式显示出他的浅薄。

sentences.english: But he liked to impress his fellow workers.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢在他的同事面前摆阔气。

sentences.english: If I have much money, I will put on the dog.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有很多钱，我会摆阔。

sentences.english: Conspicuous consumption was a manifestation of power.
sentences.chinese: 炫耀摆阔性的消费是力量的证明。

sentences.english: Their daughter was ostentatious on her wedding reception.
sentences.chinese: 他们的女儿在办婚事时摆阔。

sentences.english: Because her father has two cars she is always putting on the dog.
sentences.chinese: 因她父亲有两部车，所以她老是摆阔。

definition: lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: extravagance and waste (idiom)
(coll.) to show off
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
newly rich/parvenu/upstart
to flaunt wealth/ostentatious
see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]
to show one's wealth/to let one's wealth show
very wealthy person
to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
erhua variant of 擺譜|摆谱[bai3 pu3]
dazzling/to show off/to flaunt
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
well-off/wealthy
